New Records: Bronny James made history in the second quarter as he and LeBron became the first father-son duo to share the floor in an NBA game.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Lakers beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 110-103 on the NBA's opening night of the regular season.
Anthony Davis finished with 36 points, 16 rebounds, 4 assists and 3 blocks.
Anthony Edwards led Minnesota in scoring with 27 points on 10-25 shooting.
Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo made their regular season debuts for the Timberwolves.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers coach JJ Redick praised his team's execution of the game plan.
LeBron James expressed pride in playing alongside his son, Bronny James.
Timberwolves coach Chris Finch acknowledged his team's lack of readiness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers have only turned the ball over 5 times in the game.
Points in the Paint: Lakers: 62, Timberwolves: 30.
